page.title: 01Dalbeattie Forest (South)
page.content: This attractive area is dominated by coniferous forest plantations, with areas of deciduous woodland, rough and improved grassland near the two roads. The landscape is undulating and hummocky, with bare rock exposed at the surface. Near Auchensheen there are several small lakes. The population is small and settlement consists of farms and several hamlets. A caravan site and three small hotels cater for the summer tourist trade but most visitors merely drive through. The residents lack local amenities, although there is a bus to Dalbeattie on weekdays.
